meanings.definition: To outwit or defeat by being more clever or skillful
meanings.sent1: She managed to outmaneuver her opponent in the chess game.
meanings.sent2: The detective was able to outmaneuver the criminal and solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox tried to outmaneuver the tricky rabbit in the forest.
meanings.sent4: In the battle of wits, he always found a way to outmaneuver his rivals.
meanings.sent5: Her quick thinking allowed her to outmaneuver the tricky situation effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To surpass in maneuvering or strategy
meanings.sent1: The skilled pilot was able to outmaneuver the other planes in the air show.
meanings.sent2: The experienced captain knew how to outmaneuver the enemy ships in the naval battle.
meanings.sent3: The race car driver tried to outmaneuver his opponents on the track.
meanings.sent4: She was able to outmaneuver the competition by taking a different approach.
meanings.sent5: The team's strategic planning helped them outmaneuver their rivals in the business world.
